column3: Added a commit to catch and shutdown gracefully in case of LevelDB errors during flush.\n
This is not sufficient (as testing by @gmaxwell shows), there are many cases where reads from the database can be triggered and aren't caught.\n

Yes, leveldb exceptions an escape from CCoinsViewDB in many other places as just the flush, and if they happen in the network code they are caught in the top-level handler, be logged, and the process will happily continue.

However, as this is strictly an improvement we should still merge this?
@laanwj Yes, I think it's definitely an improvement.\n
Tested ACK.  (As pieter notes, we still have things to fit in this respect, but better is better)\n

@sipa Why did you choose to leave out the indentation? Our code get's pretty ugly again over time? Could we finally let the clang-format tool let do it's job and we also had a remove orphan spaces and tabs script if I remember correctly...\n
